org.osmdroid.google.wrapper

Class Projection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.osmdroid.google.wrapper.Projection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IProjection

    public class Projection
extends Object
implements IProjection
    A wrapper for the Google com.google.android.maps.Projection implementation. This implements IProjection, which is also implemented by the osmdroid org.osmdroid.views.MapView.Projection.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Projection(com.google.android.maps.MapView aMapView) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IGeoPoint fromPixels(int x, int y)
      Create a new GeoPoint from pixel coordinates relative to the top-left of the MapView that provided this PixelConverter.
      IGeoPoint getNorthEast()
      Get the coordinates of the most north-easterly visible point of the map.
      IGeoPoint getSouthWest()
      Get the coordinates of the most south-westerly visible point of the map.
      float metersToEquatorPixels(float meters)
      Converts a distance in meters (along the equator) to one in (horizontal) pixels at the current zoomlevel.
      Point toPixels(IGeoPoint in, Point out)
      Converts the given IGeoPoint to onscreen pixel coordinates, relative to the top-left of the MapView that provided this Projection.

      • toPixels

        public Point toPixels(IGeoPoint in,
                      Point out)
        Description copied from interface: IProjection
        Converts the given IGeoPoint to onscreen pixel coordinates, relative to the top-left of the MapView that provided this Projection.
        Specified by:
        toPixels in interface IProjection
        Parameters:
        in - The latitude/longitude pair to convert.
        out - A pre-existing object to use for the output; if null, a new Point will be allocated and returned.

      • metersToEquatorPixels

        public float metersToEquatorPixels(float meters)
        Description copied from interface: IProjection
        Converts a distance in meters (along the equator) to one in (horizontal) pixels at the current zoomlevel. In the default Mercator projection, the actual number of pixels for a given distance will get higher as you move away from the equator.
        Specified by:
        metersToEquatorPixels in interface IProjection
        Parameters:
        meters - the distance in meters
        Returns:
        The number of pixels corresponding to the distance, if measured along the equator, at the current zoom level. The return value may only be approximate.
